alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"As hydrogen has a high CIV compared to the other elements, it will recombine first, in a cylindrical shell of larger radius than the shells of the other elements.

This type of electrical sorting may be responsible for some of the non-random distribution of elements that we observe in the cosmos. In particular, it may explain the preponderance of neutral hydrogen in thread-like structures throughout the galaxy that have been detected by radio telescopes."

Another consequence of these circling charged particles which can be worked out from geometry alone is that they will induce both a long-range attraction AND short-range repulsion between parallel filaments.  Thus, two-ness is a common feature of plasma filamentation because like the filament itself, it is also a self-stable structure.

What that implies is that the EMF can be extended to INFINITE DISTANCES.
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Why Cosmic Filaments Are Electric - 10
